etomica.util

Class HistoryCollapsingAverage

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsing
      • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsingDiscard
        • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsingAverage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    History

    public class HistoryCollapsingAverage
extends HistoryCollapsingDiscard
    History that records a number of values. When existing space is insufficient to hold new data, the existing data is "collapsed" such that all existing data is stored in the first half of existing storage by averaging each consecutive pair of data points. After that point, data will be stored as average block data.

    • Method Detail

      • addValue

        public boolean addValue(double x,
                        double y)
        adds data to the history. If insufficient space exists to store the data, existing data is collapsed by 1/2 and future data is taken half as much.
        Specified by:
        addValue in interface History
        Overrides:
        addValue in class HistoryCollapsingDiscard

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: HistoryCollapsing
        Removes entire history, setting all values to NaN. After calling reset, data will be recorded at every interval.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface History
        Overrides:
        reset in class HistoryCollapsing
